This article states the government's intentions to curb back the bonus culture, whereby people are awarded monetary rewards for failure: 

http://www.guardian.co.uk/business/2012/jan/15/vince-cable-summopns-bosses-bonuses?INTCMP=SRCH

And then this article, some 12 days later states that this guy is worth nearly £1m for good performance despite the share price of Royal Bank of Scotland being worse than when the guy took over. This is a company that is 80% owned by the UK government. They get to decide how much he should be paid. 

http://www.guardian.co.uk/business/2012/jan/27/anger-grows-rbs-chiefs-bonus

So, is this rewarding failure, or something different?
